intro: Acrostephanus truncatus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Acrostephanus truncatus is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
